page.title: 02ECOLOGY , BIRDS
page.content: 47 species of bird use the estuary. Ruff, Curlew, Dunlin, Redshank and Shelduck are so common that they exceed 1% British population standard. At least 14,000 waders and ducks feed on the mud flats that start at the southern end of the block. General bird life is a mixture of sea and land with a limited number of exclusive river birds. Herring gulls are particularly numerous during the ploughing season and the low lying nature of the terrain makes it most suitable for the land/sea mix.
